rev.diff:
Line 71: Line 71:
*The [[submachine gun]]s used by Tintin, his friends and their enemies do not appear to be based on real weapons. For example, the [[drum magazine]] on Haddock's gun is strangely positioned on top of the main weapon, which would hinder aiming and the feeding of bullets. This is curious since much of the background, cars, ships, aircraft and other items used in Tintin's adventures were based on extensive research. Tintin's gun appears to be based on the [[MP40]], though it lacks the vertical [[Magazine (firearms)|magazine]]. Some of the Sondonesians are armed with [[Thompson submachine gun]]s.
*The [[submachine gun]]s used by Tintin, his friends and their enemies do not appear to be based on real weapons. For example, the [[drum magazine]] on Haddock's gun is strangely positioned on top of the main weapon, which would hinder aiming and the feeding of bullets. This is curious since much of the background, cars, ships, aircraft and other items used in Tintin's adventures were based on extensive research. Tintin's gun appears to be based on the [[MP40]], though it lacks the vertical [[Magazine (firearms)|magazine]]. Some of the Sondonesians are armed with [[Thompson submachine gun]]s.
â
*In the English translation, [[Minor characters in The Adventures of Tintin#Doctor Krollspell|Dr. Krollspell]] is the former head of a psychiatric clinic in [[Cairo]], but in the [[The Adventures of Tintin (TV series)|animated television series]] it is based in [[New Delhi]], as was the case in the original French version. (Tintin has an unpleasant time in such a clinic in India in ''[[Cigars of the Pharaoh]]''.)
+
*In the English translation, [[Characters in The Adventures of Tintin#Doctor Krollspell|Dr. Krollspell]] is the former head of a psychiatric clinic in [[Cairo]], but in the [[The Adventures of Tintin (TV series)|animated television series]] it is based in [[New Delhi]], as was the case in the original French version. (Tintin has an unpleasant time in such a clinic in India in ''[[Cigars of the Pharaoh]]''.)
